data.name: GORIMG_ERR_ALREADY_EDITING
data.value: The image is already being edited. Call EndUpdate before calling BeginUpdate to edit the image.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_BITMAP_SIZE_NOT_CORRECT
data.value: The size of the bitmap ({0}x{1}) is not the same as the buffer ({2}x{3}).

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_BUFFER_FORMAT_MISMATCH
data.value: The buffer formats must be same: [{0}].

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_CODEC_NOT_IN_PLUGIN
data.value: The codec '{0}' was not found in the plug-in.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_COMPRESSED_SIZE_INCORRECT
data.value: The compressed image with and height must be a multiple of 4. Current width and height: {0}x{1}

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_FILE_FORMAT_NOT_CORRECT
data.value: The file data stored in the stream is not a '{0}' file.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_FORMAT_IS_NOT_16BPP
data.value: The format supplied, [{0}], is not a 16 bits per pixel format.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_FORMAT_NOT_SUPPORTED
data.value: The image format [{0}] is not supported.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_IMAGE_BYTE_LENGTH_TOO_SHORT
data.value: The size of the image data in the stream must be at least 1 byte.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_IMAGE_DEPTH_TOO_SMALL
data.value: The image depth must be at least 1 pixel.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_IMAGE_HEIGHT_TOO_SMALL
data.value: The image height must be at least 1 pixel.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_IMAGE_SIZE_MISMATCH
data.value: The calculated size if the image ({0} bytes) is larger than the amount of data available ({1} bytes). This could lead to a buffer overrun.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_IMAGE_WIDTH_TOO_SMALL
data.value: The image width must be at least 1 pixel.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_INDEX_OUT_OF_RANGE
data.value: The value must be between {0} and {1}.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_MISSING_BLOCK_COUNT
data.value: The block count must be larger than 0.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_STREAM_CANNOT_SEEK
data.value: The steam is not seekable.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_STREAM_IS_READONLY
data.value: The stream is read only.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_STREAM_IS_WRITEONLY
data.value: The stream is write only.

data.name: GORIMG_ERR_TGA_TYPE_NOT_SUPPORTED
data.value: This codec does not support TGA files encoded using 2 or 4 way interleaving, or color mapped data.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_GIF_ALPHA_THRESHOLD
data.value:
Alpha value threshold for transparency.
GIF encoded images can use a single color index from the palette to indicate transparency. When downsampling an image to an indexed color palette, and the alpha value of the pixel is less than the value specified here, the codec will treat the pixel as the transparent index in the GIF image palette.
This value has a range of 0 to 1.0. Where 0 indicates no transparency, and 1.0 means all pixels are transparent.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_JPG_QUALITY
data.value:
Image quality.
Specifies the lossy compression quality to use when encoding a JPEG image. The higher the value, the worse the less compression that is used, and the better the image quality.
This value has a range of 0 to 1.0. Where 0 is the best compression, but the worst quality, and 1.0 is no compression and the best quality.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_PNG_FILTERING
data.value:
Scanline fitering type.
Specified how to filter scanlines when encoding PNG files.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_PNG_INTERLACED
data.value:
Use interlacing
Specifies whether or not to use interlacing for scanlines in the PNG file.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_READ_ALL_FRAMES
data.value:
Read all frames as image array.
Images with multiple frames will have these frames decoded as multiple indices in the image.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_SAVE_ALL_FRAMES
data.value:
Save all frames as image array.
Images with multiple frames will have these frames encoded as array indices in the image.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_TGA_SETZEROALPHA_OPAQUE
data.value:
Force opaque when image is transparent.
Some 32 bit per pixel TGA images are written out with their alpha values as 0, even though color data is present in the image. This option will force the TGA file to be decoded as though it has opaque alpha channels.
Note: If there are a mix of alpha values in the image, then this option will be ignored.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_WIC_DITHERING
data.value:
Dithering type.
Defines how to handle downsampling the pixel data from a higher bit depth so that image quality is preserved.

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_WIC_DPIX
data.value: Horizontal DPI

data.name: GORIMG_OPT_WIC_DPIY
data.value: Vertical DPI

data.name: GORIMG_TOSTR_FMTPITCH
data.value: Image pitch information. Width={0} bytes, Size={1} bytes.

data.name: GORIMG_TOSTR_FMTPITCH_COMPRESSED
data.value: Image pitch information. Width={0} bytes, Size={1} bytes. Format is compressed. Block count width: {2}, Block count height: {3}
